subject: AI & Agents
title: AI Doesn't Learn Like You Do
description: A quick, practical guide to AI Doesn't Learn Like You Do.

hook.text: Show a child one cat and it knows all cats. Show AI 10,000 cats and it still misses cats in costumes.

buildup.text: Humans learn from tiny amounts of data using prior knowledge, analogies, and embodied experience.

discovery.text: AI learns statistical correlations from massive datasets, not conceptual understanding from experience.

twist.text: This is why AI can ace a medical exam but not understand why a patient is scared of needles.

climax.text: Few-shot learning bridges some of this gap, but fundamental differences in learning remain vast.

punchline.text: Ten thousand examples to learn what a toddler gets in one.

quiz.question: How does human learning fundamentally differ from AI learning?
options: Humans learn from minimal data using prior knowledge and experience
Humans and AI learn in exactly the same way
Humans require more data than AI to learn
